Belgium: The Saint-Joseph reaches its home port of Ostend from a voyage to Canton.
Brazil: Filipe dos Santos Revolt, also known as the Vila Rica Revolt. The Capitania de Minas Gerais (Captaincy of Minas Gerais) is established, after being separated from the Captaincy of SÃ£o Paulo and Minas de Ouro.
China: Chinese expedition to Tibet: A Qing expedition expelled the invading forces of the Dzungar Khanate from Tibet.
France: Treaty of The Hague: France and its allies signed a treaty with Spain, thus ending the War of the Quadruple Alliance.
India: Bajirao I appointed by Shahu Maharaj as Peshwa (prime minister) who would later expand the Maratha empire to cover most of present-day India.
Japan: The foreign books restrictions are reduced, starting a Rangaku practice.
Sweden: Treaty of Frederiksborg, requiring Sweden to cede Schleswig to Denmark-Norway
